data.title: 键入缺少的字母，完成下面的文字

data.partBlankContent: The point of all of this is that guessing is not necessarily harmful to you. Below, you wi__ learn exa____ when t_ guess. For n__, under_____ that tho___ the SAT may b_ graded diffe______ than t__ way i_ which y__ are us__ to hav___ your te___ graded, it do__ not me__ that i_ is a harder sys___. data.fullContent: The point of all of this is that guessing is not necessarily harmful to you. Below, you will learn exactly when to guess. For now, understand that though the SAT may be graded differently than the way in which you are used to having your tests graded, it does not mean that it is a harder system. Learn to accept it now and look on the SAT as a challenge, not a necessary evil.
data.answer: 所有这些的重点是猜测不一定对你有害。下面，你就会知道什么时候该猜了。现在，请理解，尽管SAT的评分方式可能与你习惯的评分方式不同，但这并不意味着它是一个更难的系统。现在就学会接受它，把SAT看作是一种挑战，而不是一种必要的灾祸。
